summary:
The Security Council:
- Welcomes Norway's initiative to convene an international donors' conference for Sudan's reconstruction and economic development upon signing a Comprehensive Peace Agreement.
- Welcomes continued operations of the Joint Military Commission, Civilian Protection Monitoring Team, and Verification and Monitoring Team.
- Reiterates readiness to consider a UN peace support operation to support a Comprehensive Peace Agreement's implementation and requests the Secretary-General to submit recommendations.
- Welcomes UNAMIS' preparatory work, endorses proposals to increase staffing, and extends its mandate until 10 March 2005.
- Calls on the region to support a Comprehensive Peace Agreement's implementation.
- Emphasizes a Comprehensive Peace Agreement's contribution to sustainable peace and stability in Sudan and Darfur crisis resolution efforts.
- Underlines progress in Abuja peace talks' importance, insists on good faith negotiations, and welcomes signed protocols.
- Demands an immediate ceasefire, humanitarian access, and compliance with international humanitarian law.
- Decides to monitor compliance and take action against non-compliant parties.
- Supports African Union decisions to increase its Darfur mission and enhance its mandate.
- Calls for urgent humanitarian contributions to Sudan and Chad.
- Requests cooperation with the International Commission of Inquiry.
- Reiterates human rights monitors' deployment importance in Darfur.
- Requests the Secretary-General to keep it informed and make recommendations.
- Decides to remain seized of the matter.
